resources.string: The current price of the crypto multiplied by its current circulating supply
The number of cryptos that are currently liquid and in circulation.
The maximum number of cryptos that will ever be issued.
The all-time-high/low trading price in selected currency.
The high/low trading price 24 hours in the selected currency.

Navigating the intricate world of cryptocurrency just got easier! With CryptoPal Crypto Glossary at your fingertips, you can effortlessly decode the maze of terms and jargon. From "blockchain" to "decentralization", each definition is crafted for clarity and simplicity. Dive in, demystify the complexities, and embrace the joy of truly understanding the world of crypto.

It is the total value of a cryptocurrency, calculated by multiplying the current price of the coin by the total number of coins in circulation. Market cap provides a quick snapshot of the relative size and importance of a cryptocurrency within the market.

Refers to the amount of a cryptocurrency that has been traded (bought and sold) in a specified time period, typically 24 hours. Volume can give an indication of the interest or activity in a particular coin or token. High trading volume often signifies a high level of interest in a particular crypto and can be associated with price volatility.

Often referred to as "circulating supply", it\'s the number of coins or tokens currently available to the public and in circulation. This doesn\'t include coins or tokens that might be held in reserve, locked, or not yet released. The available supply can influence the price of the cryptocurrency a lower supply with high demand can lead to price increases.

This represents the maximum number of coins or tokens that will ever exist for that cryptocurrency. It includes coins or tokens that have already been mined or released, as well as those that are yet to be mined or are held in reserve. Some cryptocurrencies, like Bitcoin, have a capped total supply (Bitcoin\'s total supply is capped at 21 million), while others might have provisions for increasing the supply over time.
